Entries.default:
Slumped against the stones of the bridge, a giant clutches at his bashed-in chest. It's a mess of sinew and blackened iron bones, fiery blood flickering between his splayed fingers.
 
Thickly rasping a breath, the warrior lifts his heated gaze to your face.
"Hnnn..."

He closes his ember-hot eyes, a relieved sigh rushing from his chest as you brew up and then tip a vial of poison to his lips. The icy, slushy mixture takes effect immediately, dousing his flames with a sweep of hoarfrost through his veins. It leaves his face cold and ashen and dead.

"Extinguished or crushed... us all... defiler..."

He struggles to speak. The agony of a slow death blazes through the scrawls in his skin, shrouding him with a veil of fire.
"I need to get to Eothas."
"What happened to you?"
[Leave him be.]
"The Maw splits... spewing rock and flame... to fight the defiler. I caught an errant boulder. To protect the brenth√≠s."
[Mercy kill by administration of poison.] "Drink this and rest easy."
[Finish him.] "This is going to hurt you more than it hurts me."

The Rathun glowers as you approach, dagger glinting from the light of his flames. 

He grasps for you with a meaty, blood-burned hand, but his swipe is clumsy and weak. You effortlessly shove his arm to the side before stabbing the knife into his already ruined chest.
"Dragon rises... Magran descends... to face the defiler... Tell the bathor in the keep..."
You twist the blade, slicing again and again while he grunts and slumps further against the gritted stone at his back until he moves no more - nor makes a sound - his hands lying limp on the ground.

Xoti swings her lantern back and forth over the warrior's body until a large, shimmering cloud of essence sifts up and into her lantern. She grunts, the lantern dipping in her hand as if heavier momentarily.
"That was worth doing, even if we got nothing in return."
"You ought to let me do the mercy killing, Watcher. That many cuts - it's not the easiest of ways to go."
"There's a cleaner way of doing these things. I'm not saying it's always better... but cleaner." Maia shrugs.

"A right good action you did there, cap. Here's hoping we don't be ending up needing that poison, though..."

He frowns at the giant corpse.
"Uhng..."
He chokes, liquid fire trickling from his lips.
"Servants of the defiler god... Damn you..."
"Damned... reaper of souls and god of lies, Magran's most foul enemy..."
More blood-fire licks from the Rathun's cracked chest, slowly charring his arm.
[Finish him.] "Eothas sends his regards."
"You're a fire giant, an elemental servant of Magran's. Aren't you?"
"What are you, creature?"
"A kindred, if larger, soul..." He wipes fire blood from his mouth with a palm that could crush a kith's skull.
"I am but one... of Magran's elite champions... birthed from her flames. Soon... reunited in glory..."
"You are not mistaken."
With a single clean swipe, you slit the warrior's throat. As his fire-blood rushes from his veins, the glowering scrawls in his skin fade into darkness.
